units.title: CellPhoneDB analysis for intercellular communication
units.text: develop CellPhoneDB v.3.0 to measure intercellular communication taking into account spatial coordinates of cells and use this tool to define cell signaling in both lumenal and glandular epithelial microenvironments.
units.rationale: Describes the computational step for quantifying cell‑cell signaling using spatial information.

units.title: Generation of uterine cell map via dataset integration
units.text: We were able to generate a uterine map of 98,568 cells from 15 individuals by integrating our dataset with previous scRNA-seq data obtained from superficial endometrial biopsies22 (Fig. 1b, Extended Data Fig. 1b–f and Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Details the creation of a comprehensive cell atlas by merging new and existing single‑cell data.

units.title: smFISH validation of proliferative marker
units.text: Single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization (smFISH) with RNAscope probes shows higher expression of the proliferative marker MKI67 in the superficial layer of the endometrium during the proliferative phase, validating Visium data (Extended Data Fig. 5a).
units.rationale: Provides an experimental validation step using smFISH to confirm spatial transcriptomics findings.

units.title: Integration of scRNA‑seq and Visium data to map SOX9 subsets
units.text: By integrating scRNA-seq and Visium data (Fig. 2e and Extended Data Fig. 4c), we define specific spatial coordinates for these SOX9 subsets: (1) noncycling SOX9+LGR5+ cells are enriched in the surface epithelium; (2) noncycling SOX9+LGR5− cells are located in the basal glands; and (3) cycling SOX9+ cells map to glands in the regenerating superficial layer.
units.rationale: Outlines the spatial mapping of distinct epithelial subpopulations using combined single‑cell and spatial data.

units.title: Single‑cell and spatial transcriptional profiling of endometrial cells
units.text: In this study, by using single-cell and spatial transcriptional profiling, we interrogate the cellular states and spatial localization of human endometrial cells during the proliferative and secretory phases of the menstrual cycle in women of reproductive age.
units.rationale: Summarizes the overall experimental approach for profiling cell states and locations across menstrual phases.
